text: Notwithstanding the provisions of §§ 14-306 and 14-307, neither the spouse or domestic partner privilege nor the physician-patient privilege shall be grounds for excluding evidence in any proceeding in the Family Division of the Superior Court of the District of Columbia concerning the welfare of a neglected child; provided, that a judge of the Family Division of the Superior Court of the District of Columbia determines such privilege should be waived in the interest of justice.
historical:
Prior Codifications

1981 Ed., § 2-1355.

1973 Ed., § 2-165.

Effect of Amendments

D.C. Law 17-231 substituted "spouse or domestic partner" for "husband-wife".

Legislative History of Laws

For legislative history of D.C. Law 2-22, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 4-1321.01.

For Law 17-231, see notes following § 4-1301.02.

DC CODE § 4-1321.05

Current through December 11, 2012
